aboutMe.title: About Me c:
aboutMe.description:
I started programming at 12 because I wanted to create a game like Minecraft. I didn’t succeed jasjdf, but I walked away understanding what programming really is, and that sparked two obsessions in me: wanting to know everything that lies beneath systems and wanting to automate everything I possibly could.

That’s how I kept moving forward, learning and exploring, until I entered university and decided to focus on frontend development. That decision opened the doors to the professional world for me.

Today I mainly work in frontend development with Angular and Vue, experiment with Rust for scripts and packages, and live in Linux because I like having full control over my system (I keep reinstalling Arch jadsjjadfs).

But I’m not just a machine that programs. I clearly have my own tastes; for example, I LOVE cyberpunk, gothic aesthetics, and early 2000s webcore.

Beyond that, I enjoy video games, anime, and music. Bodybuilding has recently become an important part of my life and I love it. I’m also passionate about DIY, about art, and about the idea that the essence of something can come from something as simple as customizing it yourself — including using my own body as a form of expression.

This is a bit about me — not just as a developer, but as a person.
